de.pifpafpuf.web.html

Class Translator

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.pifpafpuf.web.html.Translator

  • public class Translator
extends Object

    translates text strings into replacemend strings and wraps them into a HtmlText objects. Instead of using code like: 

    new Html("p").addText("hello");

    you now use 

    Translator lang = new Translator(); // and fill it with data
...
new Html("p").add(lang.trans("hello"));

    The assumption is that the translator lang was previously selected depending on the user's language settings.

    Why do we not use ResourceBundle? Well, it throws mean things at us if a key has no value, and there is no way to specify default return values.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Translator()
      creates an empty instance with no translations.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(String text,
       String translation)
        adds a translation.

      • trans

        public HtmlText trans(String text)

        prepare an HtmlText with the translation of text. If no translation is available, text is used untranslated.

      • trans

        public HtmlText trans(String text,
             String defaultText)
        prepare an HtmlText with the translation of text. If no translation is available, the defaultText is used.
